<ProgramListing>

<Link id="l00001" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===---------- AArch64CollectLOH.cpp - AArch64 collect LOH pass --&#42;- C++ -&#42;-=//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00002" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00003" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Part of the LLVM Project, under the Apache License v2.0 with LLVM Exceptions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00004" /><CodeLine lineNumber="4"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// See https://llvm.org/LICENSE.txt for license information.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00005" /><CodeLine lineNumber="5"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SPDX-License-Identifier: Apache-2.0 WITH LLVM-exception</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00006" /><CodeLine lineNumber="6"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file contains a pass that collect the Linker Optimization Hint (LOH).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This pass should be run at the very end of the compilation flow, just before</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// assembly printer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To be useful for the linker, the LOH must be printed into the assembly file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A LOH describes a sequence of instructions that may be optimized by the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// linker.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This same sequence cannot be optimized by the compiler because some of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the information will be known at link time.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For instance, consider the following sequence:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L1: adrp xA, sym@PAGE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L2: add xB, xA, sym@PAGEOFF</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L3: ldr xC, &#91;xB, #imm&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This sequence can be turned into:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A literal load if sym@PAGE + sym@PAGEOFF + #imm - address(L3) is &lt; 1MB:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L3: ldr xC, sym+#imm</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It may also be turned into either the following more efficient</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// code sequences:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - If sym@PAGEOFF + #imm fits the encoding space of L3.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L1: adrp xA, sym@PAGE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L3: ldr xC, &#91;xB, sym@PAGEOFF + #imm&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - If sym@PAGE + sym@PAGEOFF - address(L1) &lt; 1MB:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L1: adr xA, sym</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L3: ldr xC, &#91;xB, #imm&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// To be valid a LOH must meet all the requirements needed by all the related</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// possible linker transformations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// For instance, using the running example, the constraints to emit</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &quot;.loh AdrpAddLdr&quot; are:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - L1, L2, and L3 instructions are of the expected type, i.e.,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   respectively ADRP, ADD (immediate), and LD.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - The result of L1 is used only by L2.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - The register argument (xA) used in the ADD instruction is defined</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   only by L1.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - The result of L2 is used only by L3.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - The base address (xB) in L3 is defined only L2.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - The ADRP in L1 and the ADD in L2 must reference the same symbol using</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   @PAGE/@PAGEOFF with no additional constants</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Currently supported LOHs are:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; So called non-ADRP-related:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   - .loh AdrpAddLdr L1, L2, L3:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L1: adrp xA, sym@PAGE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L2: add xB, xA, sym@PAGEOFF</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L3: ldr xC, &#91;xB, #imm&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   - .loh AdrpLdrGotLdr L1, L2, L3:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L1: adrp xA, sym@GOTPAGE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L2: ldr xB, &#91;xA, sym@GOTPAGEOFF&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L3: ldr xC, &#91;xB, #imm&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   - .loh AdrpLdr L1, L3:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L1: adrp xA, sym@PAGE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L3: ldr xC, &#91;xA, sym@PAGEOFF&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   - .loh AdrpAddStr L1, L2, L3:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L1: adrp xA, sym@PAGE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L2: add xB, xA, sym@PAGEOFF</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L3: str xC, &#91;xB, #imm&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   - .loh AdrpLdrGotStr L1, L2, L3:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L1: adrp xA, sym@GOTPAGE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L2: ldr xB, &#91;xA, sym@GOTPAGEOFF&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L3: str xC, &#91;xB, #imm&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   - .loh AdrpAdd L1, L2:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L1: adrp xA, sym@PAGE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     L2: add xB, xA, sym@PAGEOFF</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   For all these LOHs, L1, L2, L3 form a simple chain:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   L1 result is used only by L2 and L2 result by L3.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   L3 LOH-related argument is defined only by L2 and L2 LOH-related argument</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   by L1.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// All these LOHs aim at using more efficient load/store patterns by folding</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// some instructions used to compute the address directly into the load/store.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#42; So called ADRP-related:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  - .loh AdrpAdrp L2, L1:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    L2: ADRP xA, sym1@PAGE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    L1: ADRP xA, sym2@PAGE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    L2 dominates L1 and xA is not redifined between L2 and L1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This LOH aims at getting rid of redundant ADRP instructions.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The overall design for emitting the LOHs is:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 1 AArch64CollectLOH (this pass) records the LOHs in the AArch64FunctionInfo.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2 AArch64AsmPrinter reads the LOHs from AArch64FunctionInfo and it:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     1 Associates them a label.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     2 Emits them in a MCStreamer (EmitLOHDirective).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         - The MCMachOStreamer records them into the MCAssembler.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         - The MCAsmStreamer prints them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         - Other MCStreamers ignore them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//     3 Closes the MCStreamer:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         - The MachObjectWriter gets them from the MCAssembler and writes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//           them in the object file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//         - Other ObjectWriters ignore them.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64-h">AArch64.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &quot;<a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/raw-ostream-h">llvm/Support/raw&#95;ostream.h</a>&quot;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="390"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aadff17100a7bcc6ddd2940e098ddbcf5aa629adeda58539821890f262b3a2176f">MCLOH&#95;AdrpAdd</a>: &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="391"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ADRPs and ADDs for this candidate may be split apart if using</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="392"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// GlobalISel instead of pseudo-expanded. If that happens, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="393"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// def register of the ADD may have a use in between. Adding an LOH in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="394"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// this case can cause the linker to rewrite the ADRP to write to that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="395"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// register, clobbering the use.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="396"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineinstr">MachineInstr</a> &#42;AddMI = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/cseinfo-cpp/#a75f8a8519c2c9b30e7c06dc5e256fffa">Info</a>.MI0;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="400"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (DefIdx != OpIdx &amp;&amp; (DefInfo.<a href="/docs/api/structs/lohinfo/#a3b6fb6984a6a36ff23c2f654d7432781">OneUser</a> || DefInfo.<a href="/docs/api/structs/lohinfo/#a453908066162ea515d123e1a555f84be">MultiUsers</a>))</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="417"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// There is a possibility that the linker may try to rewrite:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="418"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// adrp x0, @sym@PAGE</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="419"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// add x1, x0, @sym@PAGEOFF</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="420"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#91;x0 = some other def&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="421"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ldr x2, &#91;x1&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    ...into...</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// adrp x0, @sym</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// nop</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#91;x0 = some other def&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ldr x2, &#91;x0&#93;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// ...if the offset to the symbol won&#39;t fit within a literal load.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This causes the load to use the result of the adrp, which in this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// case has already been clobbered.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="430"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: Implement proper liveness tracking for all registers. For now,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="431"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// don&#39;t emit the LOH if there are any instructions between the add and</span></CodeLine>
